parameter.name: problem: type
parameter.description: Type of problem to be solved. Possible values: see Table~\ref{t:problem_types}.
parameter.comment-ML: needs special treatment in ML. problem types have different names in ML and MueLu

parameter.name: verbosity
parameter.description: Control of the amount of printed information. Possible values: "none", "low", "medium", "high", "extreme".
parameter.comment-ML: The ML type of this parameter is int! MLParameter interpreter transformes int to MueLu verbosity strings
parameter.description-ML: Control of the amount of printed information. Possible values: 0-10 with 0=no output and 10=maximum verbosity.

parameter.name: number of equations
parameter.description: Number of PDE equations at each grid node. Only constant block size is considered.
parameter.description-ML: Number of PDE equations at each grid node. Only constant block size is considered.

parameter.name: max levels
parameter.description: Maximum number of levels in a hierarchy.
parameter.description-ML: Maximum number of levels in a hierarchy.

parameter.name: cycle type
parameter.description: Multigrid cycle type. Possible values: "V", "W".
parameter.comment-ML: needs special treatment in ML. ML uses different namings than MueLu
parameter.description-ML: Multigrid cycle type. Possible values: "MGV", "MGW". Other values are NOT supported by MueLu.

parameter.name: problem: symmetric
parameter.description: Symmetry of a problem. This setting affects the construction of a restrictor. If set to true, the restrictor is set to be the transpose of a prolongator. If set to false, underlying multigrid algorithm makes the decision.

parameter.name: smoother: pre or post
parameter.description: Pre- and post-smoother combination. Possible values: "pre" (only pre-smoother), "post" (only post-smoother), "both" (both pre-and post-smoothers), "none" (no smoothing).
parameter.description-ML: Pre- and post-smoother combination. Possible values: "pre" (only pre-smoother), "post" (only post-smoother), "both" (both pre-and post-smoothers).

parameter.name: smoother: type
parameter.description: Smoother type. Possible values: see Table~\ref{tab:smoothers}.

parameter.name: smoother: pre type
parameter.description: Pre-smoother type. Possible values: see Table~\ref{tab:smoothers}.

parameter.name: smoother: post type
parameter.description: Post-smoother type. Possible values: see Table~\ref{tab:smoothers}.

parameter.name: smoother: params
parameter.description: Smoother parameters. For standard smoothers, \muelu passes them directly to the appropriate package library.

parameter.name: smoother: pre params
parameter.description: Pre-smoother parameters. For standard smoothers, \muelu passes them directly to the appropriate package library.

parameter.name: smoother: post params
parameter.description: Post-smoother parameters. For standard smoothers, \muelu passes them directly to the appropriate package library.

parameter.name: smoother: overlap
parameter.description: Smoother subdomain overlap.

parameter.name: smoother: pre overlap
parameter.description: Pre-smoother subdomain overlap.

parameter.name: smoother: post overlap
parameter.description: Post-smoother subdomain overlap.

parameter.name: coarse: max size
parameter.description: Maximum dimension of a coarse grid. \muelu will stop coarsening once it is achieved.
parameter.description-ML: Maximum dimension of a coarse grid. \ml will stop coarsening once it is achieved.

parameter.name: coarse: type
parameter.description: Coarse solver. Possible values: see Table~\ref{tab:coarse_solvers}.

parameter.name: coarse: params
parameter.description: Coarse solver parameters. \muelu passes them directly to the appropriate package library.

parameter.name: coarse: overlap
parameter.description: Coarse solver subdomain overlap.

parameter.name: aggregation: type
parameter.description: Aggregation scheme. Possible values: see Table~\ref{t:aggregation}.

parameter.name: aggregation: ordering
parameter.description: Node ordering strategy. Possible values: "natural" (local index order), "graph" (filtered graph breadth-first order), "random" (random local index order).

parameter.name: aggregation: drop scheme
parameter.description: Connectivity dropping scheme for a graph used in aggregation. Possible values: "classical", "distance laplacian".

parameter.name: aggregation: drop tol
parameter.description: Connectivity dropping threshold for a graph used in aggregation.

parameter.name: aggregation: min agg size
parameter.description: Minimum size of an aggregate.

parameter.name: aggregation: max agg size
parameter.description: Maximum size of an aggregate (-1 means unlimited).

parameter.name: aggregation: max selected neighbors
parameter.description: Maximum number of neighbour nodes that are already aggregated. If a new aggregate has some neighbours that are already aggregated, this node probably can be added to one of these aggregates. We don't need a new one.

parameter.name: aggregation: Dirichlet threshold
parameter.description: Threshold for determining whether entries are zero during Dirichlet row detection.

parameter.name: aggregation: enable phase 1
parameter.description: Turn on/off phase 1 of aggregation

parameter.name: aggregation: enable phase 2a
parameter.description: Turn on/off phase 2a of aggregation

parameter.name: aggregation: enable phase 2b
parameter.description: Turn on/off phase 2b of aggregation

parameter.name: aggregation: enable phase 3
parameter.description: Turn on/off phase 3 of aggregation

parameter.name: aggregation: preserve Dirichlet points
parameter.description: Turn on/off Dirichlet points preservation

parameter.name: aggregation: export visualization data
parameter.description: Export data for visualization post-processing.

parameter.name: aggregation: mode
parameter.description: old = Tobias, new = ML

parameter.name: export data
parameter.description: Exporting a subset of the hierarchy data in a file. Currently, the list can contain any of three parameter names ("A", ``P'', ``R'') of type \texttt{string} and value ``\{levels separated by commas\}''. A matrix with a name ``X'' is saved in three MatrixMarket files: a) data is saved in \textit{X\_level.mm}; b) its row map is saved in \textit{rowmap\_X\_level.mm}; c) its column map is saved in \textit{colmap\_X\_level.mm}.

parameter.name: print initial parameters
parameter.description: Print parameters provided for a hierarchy construction.

parameter.name: print unused parameters
parameter.description: Print parameters unused during a hierarchy construction.

parameter.name: transpose: use implicit
parameter.description: Use implicit transpose for the restriction operator.

parameter.name: multigrid algorithm
parameter.description: Multigrid method. Possible values: see Table~\ref{t:mgs}.
parameter.description-ML: Enable energy minimization transfer operators (using Petrov-Galerkin approach).

parameter.name: semicoarsen: coarsen rate
parameter.description: Rate at which to coarsen unknowns in the z direction.

parameter.name: sa: damping factor
parameter.description: Damping factor for smoothed aggregation.

parameter.name: sa: use filtered matrix
parameter.description: Matrix to use for smoothing the tentative prolongator. The two options are: to use the original matrix, and to use the filtered matrix with filtering based on filtered graph used for aggregation.

parameter.name: sa: calculate eigenvalue estimate
parameter.description: Force calculation of eigenvalue estimate during prolongator smoothing.

parameter.name: sa: eigenvalue estimate num iterations
parameter.description: Number of power iterations to use to estimate max eigenvalue. This has effect only if estimation occurs during prolongator smoothing.

parameter.name: filtered matrix: use lumping
parameter.description: Lump (add to diagonal) dropped entries during the construction of a filtered matrix. This allows user to preserve constant nullspace.

parameter.name: filtered matrix: reuse eigenvalue
parameter.description: Skip eigenvalue calculation during the construction of a filtered matrix by reusing eigenvalue estimate from the original matrix. This allows us to skip heavy computation, but may lead to poorer convergence.

parameter.name: filtered matrix: reuse graph
parameter.description: Set values to zero instead of constructing a new graph.

parameter.name: emin: iterative method
parameter.description: Iterative method to use for energy minimization of initial prolongator in energy-minimization. Possible values: "cg" (conjugate gradient), "sd" (steepest descent).

parameter.name: emin: num iterations
parameter.description: Number of iterations to minimize initial prolongator energy in energy-minimization.

parameter.name: emin: num reuse iterations
parameter.description: Number of iterations to minimize the reused prolongator energy in energy-minimization.

parameter.name: emin: pattern
parameter.description: Sparsity pattern to use for energy minimization. Possible values: "AkPtent".

parameter.name: emin: pattern order
parameter.description: Matrix order for the "AkPtent" pattern.

parameter.name: repartition: enable
parameter.description: Rebalancing on/off switch.
parameter.description-ML: Rebalancing on/off switch. Only limited support for repartitioning. Does not use provided node coordinates.

parameter.name: repartition: partitioner
parameter.description: Partitioning package to use. Possible values: "zoltan" (\zoltan{} library), "zoltan2" (\zoltantwo{} library).

parameter.name: repartition: params
parameter.description: Partitioner parameters. \muelu passes them directly to the appropriate package library.

parameter.name: repartition: start level
parameter.description: Minimum level to run partitioner. \muelu does not rebalance levels finer than this one.
parameter.description-ML: Minimum level to run partitioner. \muelu does not rebalance levels finer than this one.

parameter.name: repartition: min rows per proc
parameter.description: Minimum number of rows per processor. If the actual number if smaller, then rebalancing occurs.
parameter.description-ML: Minimum number of rows per processor. If the actual number if smaller, then rebalancing occurs.

parameter.name: repartition: max imbalance
parameter.description: Maximum nonzero imbalance ratio. If the actual number is larger, the rebalancing occurs.
parameter.description-ML: Maximum nonzero imbalance ratio. If the actual number is larger, the rebalancing occurs.

parameter.name: repartition: remap parts
parameter.description: Postprocessing for partitioning to reduce data migration.

parameter.name: repartition: remap num values
parameter.description: Number of maximum components from each processor used to construct partial bipartite graph.

parameter.name: repartition: print partition distribution
parameter.description: Partition distribution printout.

parameter.name: repartition: rebalance P and R
parameter.description: Explicit rebalancing of R and P during the setup. This speeds up the solve, but slows down the setup phases.
